content:
Sunday meal prep is a great idea! Preparing a big batch of rice, roasting some vegetables, and grilling some chicken or salmon is an excellent starting point. This will give you a solid foundation for the week ahead. Here's why:

**Rice**: Cooking a large batch of rice will provide a versatile base for various meals. You can use it to make bowls, salads, or as a side dish. Brown rice, in particular, is a great choice because it's nutritious and can be flavored with herbs and spices to match your meal prep goals.

**Roasted Vegetables**: Roasting a variety of vegetables like broccoli, cauliflower, carrots, and sweet potatoes will give you a delicious and healthy snack or side dish for the week. You can season them with olive oil, salt, and pepper, or add some herbs and spices to give them extra flavor.

**Grilled Chicken or Salmon**: Grilling chicken breasts or salmon fillets will provide a protein-rich component for your meals. You can season them with your favorite herbs and spices, and use them in a variety of dishes, such as salads, wraps, or as a topping for rice bowls.

With these three components, you'll have a solid foundation for the week ahead. Here are some meal ideas you can create using these ingredients:

* Monday: Grilled Chicken and Veggie Bowl with Brown Rice
* Tuesday: Salmon and Avocado Salad with Roasted Vegetables
* Wednesday: Chicken and Veggie Wrap with Brown Rice and Guacamole
* Thursday: Roasted Veggie and Quinoa Bowl with Grilled Chicken
* Friday: Salmon and Brown Rice Bowl with Steamed Broccoli

Tips to keep in mind:

* Portion control: Divide your cooked ingredients into individual portions to make reheating and assembling meals easier.
* Label and store: Label and store your meal prep containers in the refrigerator or freezer to keep track of what you have and how long it's been stored.
* Mix and match: Don't be afraid to mix and match your ingredients to create new meals or add variety to your dishes.
* Add some flavor: Experiment with different seasonings, herbs, and spices to add flavor to your meals.

By starting with these three ingredients, you'll be well on your way to a successful meal prep routine. Happy cooking!
